paper_abstract: We show that provided log50n/np1-n-1/4log9n we can with high probability find a collection of (G)/2 edge-disjoint Hamilton cycles in G approximate to Gn,p, plus an additional edge-disjoint matching of size n/2 if (G) is odd. This is clearly optimal and confirms, for the above range of p, a conjecture of Frieze and Krivelevich. (c) 2013 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 46, 397-445, 2015
paper_title: Edge-disjoint Hamilton Cycles in Random Graphs
